summary.para: Implements the interface, and allows you to interact with the adb server and devices that are connected to that adb server.
For example, to fetch a list of all devices that are currently connected to this PC, you can call the method.
To run a command on a device, you can use the method.

summary.para: Provides methods for interacting with the adb server. The adb server must be running for the rest of the Managed.Adb library to work.

The adb server is a background process that runs on the host machine. Its purpose if to sense the USB ports to know when devices are attached/removed, as well as when emulator instances start/stop. The ADB server is really one giant multiplexing loop whose purpose is to orchestrate the exchange of data between clients and devices.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.AdbServer.RequiredAdbVersion
member.summary: The minimum version of adb.exe that is supported by this library.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.AdbServer.ConnectionRefused
member.summary: The error code that is returned by the when the connection is refused.
member.remarks: No connection could be made because the target computer actively refused it.This usually results from trying to connect to a service that is inactive on the foreign hostâ€”that is, one with no server application running.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.AdbServer.ConnectionReset
member.summary: The error code that is returned by the when the connection was reset by the peer.
member.remarks: An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host. This normally results if the peer application on the remote host is suddenly stopped, the host is rebooted, the host or remote network interface is disabled, or the remote host uses a hard close. This error may also result if a connection was broken due to keep-alive activity detecting a failure while one or more operations are in progress.

summary.para: Implements a client for the Android Debug Bridge client-server protocol. Using the client, you can send messages to and receive messages from the Android Debug Bridge.
The class implements the raw messaging protocol; that is, sending and receiving messages. For interacting with the services the Android Debug Bridge exposes, use the .
For more information about the protocol that is implemented here, see chapter II Protocol Details, section 1. Client <->Server protocol at .

member.param: The at which the Android Debug Bridge is listening for clients.
The logger to use when logging.

member.name: T:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess
member.summary: Represents a process running on an Android device.

member.name: M:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct from it representation.
member.param: A which represents a .
A value indicating whether the output of /proc/{pid}/stat is prefixed with /proc/{pid}/cmdline or not. Because stat does not contain the full process name, this can be useful.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.State
member.summary: Gets or sets the state of the process.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the process, including arguments, if any.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ParentProcessId
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent Process ID number.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ProcessGroupId
member.summary: Gets or sets the Process Group ID number.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.SessionID
member.summary: Gets or sets the session ID of the process number.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ProcessId
member.summary: Gets or sets the Process ID number.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.TTYNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the controlling terminal of the process.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.TopProcessGroupId
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the foreground process group of the controlling terminal of the process.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.Flags
member.summary: Gets or sets The kernel flags word of the process. For bit meanings, see the PF_* defines in the Linux kernel source file include/linux/sched.h. Details depend on the kernel version.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.MinorFaults
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of minor faults the process has made which have not required loading a memory page from disk.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ChildMinorFaults
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of minor faults that the process's waited-for children have made.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.MajorFaults
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of major faults the process has made which have required loading a memory page from disk.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ChildMajorFaults
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of major faults that the process's waited-for children have made.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.UserScheduledTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time that this process has been scheduled in user mode, measured in clock ticks (divide by sysconf(_SC_CLK_TCK)). This includes guest time, guest_time (time spent running a virtual CPU, see below), so that applications that are not aware of the guest time field do not lose that time from their calculations.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ScheduledTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time that this process has been scheduled in kernel mode, measured in clock ticks (divide by sysconf(_SC_CLK_TCK)).

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ChildUserScheduledTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time that this process's waited-for children have been scheduled in user mode, measured in clock ticks (divide by sysconf(_SC_CLK_TCK)). (See also times(2).) This includes guest time, cguest_time (time spent running a virtual CPU, see below).

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ChildScheduledTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the Amount of time that this process's waited-for children have been scheduled in kernel mode, measured in clock ticks (divide by sysconf(_SC_CLK_TCK)).

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.Priority
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for processes running a real-time scheduling policy (policy below; see sched_setscheduler(2)), this is the negated scheduling priority, minus one; that is, a number in the range to , corresponding to real-time priorities to . For processes running under a non-real-time scheduling policy, this is the raw nice value (setpriority(2)) as represented in the kernel. The kernel stores nice values as numbers in the range (high) to (low), corresponding to the user-visible nice range of to .

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.Nice
member.summary: Gets or sets the nice value (see setpriority(2)), a value in the range (low priority) to (high priority).

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ThreadsNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of threads in this process (since Linux 2.6).
member.remarks: Before kernel 2.6, this field was hard coded to 0 as a placeholder for an earlier removed field.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.Interval
member.summary: Gets or sets the time in jiffies before the next SIGALRM is sent to the process due to an interval timer.
member.remarks: Since kernel 2.6.17, this field is no longer maintained, and is hard coded as 0.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets The time the process started after system boot. In kernels before Linux 2.6, this value was expressed in jiffies.Since Linux 2.6, the value is expressed in clock ticks (divide by sysconf(_SC_CLK_TCK)).
member.remarks: The format for this field was %lu before Linux 2.6.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.VirtualSize
member.summary: Gets or sets total virtual memory size in bytes.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ResidentSetSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the process resident set size.
member.value: Number of pages the process has in real memory. This is just the pages which count toward text, data, or stack space. This does not include pages which have not been demand-loaded in, or which are swapped out. This value is inaccurate; see /proc/[pid]/statm below.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ResidentSetSizeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets current soft limit in bytes on the rss of the process; See the description of RLIMIT_RSS in getrlimit(2).

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.StartCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the address above which program text can run.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.EndCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the address below which program text can run.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.StartStack
member.summary: Gets or sets the address of the start (i.e., bottom) of the stack.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ESP
member.summary: Gets or sets the current value of ESP (stack pointer), as found in the kernel stack page for the process.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.EIP
member.summary: Gets or sets the current EIP (instruction pointer).

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.Signal
member.summary: Gets or sets the bitmap of pending signals, displayed as a decimal number. Obsolete, because it does not provide information on real-time signals; Use /proc/[pid]/status instead.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.Blocked
member.summary: Gets or sets the bitmap of blocked signals, displayed as a decimal number. Obsolete, because it does not provide information on real-time signals; Use /proc/[pid]/status instead.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.IgnoredSignals
member.summary: Gets or sets the bitmap of ignored signals, displayed as a decimal number. Obsolete, because it does not provide information on real-time signals; Use /proc/[pid]/status instead.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.CaughtSignals
member.summary: Gets or sets the bitmap of caught signals, displayed as a decimal number. Obsolete, because it does not provide information on real-time signals; Use /proc/[pid]/status instead.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.WChan
member.summary: Gets or sets the memory address of the event the process is waiting for.
member.value: This is the "channel" in which the process is waiting. It is the address of a location in the kernel where the process is sleeping. The corresponding symbolic name can be found in /proc/[pid]/wchan.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.SwappedPagesNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of pages swapped (not maintained).

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.CumulativeSwappedPagesNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the cumulative number of pages swapped for child processes (not maintained).

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ExitSignal
member.summary: Gets or sets the signal to be sent to parent when we die.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.Processor
member.summary: Gets or sets the CPU number last executed on.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.RealTimePriority
member.summary: Gets or sets the real-time scheduling priority, a number in the range 1 to 99 for processes scheduled under a real-time policy, or 0, for non-real-time processes (see sched_setscheduler(2)).

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.Policy
member.summary: Gets or sets the scheduling policy (see sched_setscheduler(2)). Decode using the SCHED_* constants in linux/sched.h.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.IODelays
member.summary: Gets or sets the aggregated block I/O delays, measured in clock ticks (centiseconds).

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.GuestTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the guest time of the process (time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system), measured in clock ticks (divide by sysconf(_SC_CLK_TCK)).

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ChildGuestTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the guest time of the process's children, measured in clock ticks (divide by sysconf(_SC_CLK_TCK)).

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.StartData
member.summary: Gets or sets the address above which program initialized and uninitialized(BSS) data are placed.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.EndData
member.summary: Gets or sets the address below which program initialized and uninitialized(BSS) data are placed.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.StartBrk
member.summary: Gets or sets the address above which program heap can be expanded with brk(2).

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ArgStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the address above which program command-line arguments (argv) are placed.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.ArgEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the address below program command-line arguments (argv) are placed.

member.name: P:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcess.EnvStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the address above which program environment is placed.

Find all descendant elements of the specified element. This method can be chained with LINQ calls to add additional filters or projections on top of the returned results.
This method is meant to provide extra flexibility in specific scenarios and it should not be used when only the first item is being looked for. In those cases, use one of the available overloads instead, which will offer a more compact syntax as well as better performance in those cases.

member.name: T:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcessState
member.summary: Represents the state of a process running on an Android device.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcessState.Unknown
member.summary: The process state is unknown.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcessState.R
member.summary: Foreground or runnable (on run queue).

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcessState.S
member.summary: Interruptible sleep (waiting for an event to complete).

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcessState.D
member.summary: Uninterruptible sleep (usually IO).

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcessState.Z
member.summary: Defunct ("zombie") process, terminated but not reaped by its parent.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcessState.T
member.summary: Stopped, either by a job control signal or because it is being traced.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcessState.W
member.summary: paging (not valid since the 2.6.xx kernel).

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcessState.X
member.summary: dead (should never be seen).

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcessState.K
member.summary: Wakekill.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.AndroidProcessState.P
member.summary: Parked.

member.name: T:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags
member.summary: Per process flags.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.Unknown
member.summary: The per process flag is unknown.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.VCPU
member.summary: I'm a virtual CPU.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.IDLE
member.summary: I am an IDLE thread.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.EXITING
member.summary: Getting shut down.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.POSTCOREDUMP
member.summary: Coredumps should ignore this task.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.IO_WORKER
member.summary: Task is an IO worker.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.WQ_WORKER
member.summary: I'm a workqueue worker.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.FORKNOEXEC
member.summary: Forked but didn't exec.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.MCE_PROCESS
member.summary: Process policy on mce errors.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.SUPERPRIV
member.summary: Used super-user privileges.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.DUMPCORE
member.summary: Dumped core.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.SIGNALED
member.summary: Killed by a signal.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.MEMALLOC
member.summary: Allocating memory.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.NPROC_EXCEEDED
member.summary: set_user() noticed that RLIMIT_NPROC was exceeded

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.USED_MATH
member.summary: If unset the fpu must be initialized before use

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.NOFREEZE
member.summary: This thread should not be frozen

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.KSWAPD
member.summary: I am kswapd

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.MEMALLOC_NOFS
member.summary: All allocation requests will inherit GFP_NOFS.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.MEMALLOC_NOIO
member.summary: All allocation requests will inherit GFP_NOIO.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.LOCAL_THROTTLE
member.summary: Throttle writes only against the bdi I write to, I am cleaning dirty pages from some other bdi.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.KTHREAD
member.summary: I am a kernel thread.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.RANDOMIZE
member.summary: Randomize virtual address space.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.NO_SETAFFINITY
member.summary: Userland is not allowed to meddle with cpus_mask.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.MCE_EARLY
member.summary: Early kill for mce process policy.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.MEMALLOC_PIN
member.summary: Allocation context constrained to zones which allow long term pinning.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.DeviceCommands.Models.PerProcessFlags.SUSPEND_TASK
member.summary: This thread called freeze_processes() and should not be frozen.

member.name: T:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.Logs.LogLevel
member.summary: Defines logging severity levels.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.Logs.LogLevel.Trace
member.summary: Logs that contain the most detailed messages. These messages may contain sensitive application data. These messages are disabled by default and should never be enabled in a production environment.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.Logs.LogLevel.Debug
member.summary: Logs that are used for interactive investigation during development. These logs should primarily contain information useful for debugging and have no long-term value.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.Logs.LogLevel.Information
member.summary: Logs that track the general flow of the application. These logs should have long-term value.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.Logs.LogLevel.Warning
member.summary: Logs that highlight an abnormal or unexpected event in the application flow, but do not otherwise cause the application execution to stop.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.Logs.LogLevel.Error
member.summary: Logs that highlight when the current flow of execution is stopped due to a failure. These should indicate a failure in the current activity, not an application-wide failure.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.Logs.LogLevel.Critical
member.summary: Logs that describe an unrecoverable application or system crash, or a catastrophic failure that requires immediate attention.

member.name: F:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.Logs.LogLevel.None
member.summary: Not used for writing log messages. Specifies that a logging category should not write any messages.

member.name: T:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.Models.ColorData

summary.para: Contains information about a color element. Information about each pixel on the screen is contained in a byte array (for example, a 4-byte array for 32-bit color depths), and a certain number of bits are reserved for each color.
For example, in a 24-bit RGB structure, the first byte contains the red color, the next byte the green color and the last byte the blue color.

member.param: The offset, in bits, within the byte array for a pixel, at which the bytes that contain information for this color are stored.
The number of bits that contain information for this color.

member.summary: The instance is now connected to the adb server. Note that this state does not imply that the Android system is fully booted and operational, since the instance connects to adb while the system is still booting. However, after boot-up, this is the normal operational state of an emulator/device instance.

member.name: M:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.IAdbClient.CreateForwardAsync(AdvancedSharpAdbClient.Models.DeviceData,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously asks the ADB server to forward local connections from to the address on the .
member.param: The device on which to forward the connections.

param.name: local
param.para: The local address to forward. This value can be in one of:

list.item: tcp:<port>: TCP connection on localhost:<port>
local:<path>: Unix local domain socket on <path>

param.name: remote
param.para: The remote address to forward. This value can be in one of:

list.item: tcp:<port>: TCP connection on localhost:<port> on device
local:<path>: Unix local domain socket on <path> on device
jdwp:<pid>: JDWP thread on VM process <pid> on device.

member.param: If set to , the request will fail if there is already a forward connection from .
A which can be used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A which represents the asynchronous operation. If your requested to start forwarding to local port TCP:0, the port number of the TCP port which has been opened. In all other cases, 0.

member.name: M:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.IAdbClient.CreateReverseForwardAsync(AdvancedSharpAdbClient.Models.DeviceData,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously asks the ADB server to reverse forward local connections from to the address on the .
member.param: The device on which to reverse forward the connections.

param.name: remote
param.para: The remote address to reverse forward. This value can be in one of:

list.item: tcp:<port>: TCP connection on localhost:<port> on device
local:<path>: Unix local domain socket on <path> on device
jdwp:<pid>: JDWP thread on VM process <pid> on device.

param.name: local
param.para: The local address to reverse forward. This value can be in one of:

list.item: tcp:<port>: TCP connection on localhost:<port>
local:<path>: Unix local domain socket on <path>

member.param: If set to , the request will fail if if the specified socket is already bound through a previous reverse command.
A which can be used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A which represents the asynchronous operation. If your requested to start reverse to remote port TCP:0, the port number of the TCP port which has been opened. In all other cases, 0.

member.name: M:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.IAdbClient.CreateForward(AdvancedSharpAdbClient.Models.DeviceData,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Asks the ADB server to forward local connections from to the address on the .
member.param: The device on which to forward the connections.

param.name: local
param.para: The local address to forward. This value can be in one of:

list.item: tcp:<port>: TCP connection on localhost:<port>
local:<path>: Unix local domain socket on <path>

param.name: remote
param.para: The remote address to forward. This value can be in one of:

list.item: tcp:<port>: TCP connection on localhost:<port> on device
local:<path>: Unix local domain socket on <path> on device
jdwp:<pid>: JDWP thread on VM process <pid> on device.

member.param: If set to , the request will fail if there is already a forward connection from .
member.returns: If your requested to start forwarding to local port TCP:0, the port number of the TCP port which has been opened. In all other cases, 0.

member.name: M:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.IAdbClient.CreateReverseForward(AdvancedSharpAdbClient.Models.DeviceData,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Asks the ADB server to reverse forward local connections from to the address on the .
member.param: The device on which to reverse forward the connections.

param.name: remote
param.para: The remote address to reverse forward. This value can be in one of:

list.item: tcp:<port>: TCP connection on localhost:<port> on device
local:<path>: Unix local domain socket on <path> on device
jdwp:<pid>: JDWP thread on VM process <pid> on device.

param.name: local
param.para: The local address to reverse forward. This value can be in one of:

list.item: tcp:<port>: TCP connection on localhost:<port>
local:<path>: Unix local domain socket on <path>

member.param: If set to , the request will fail if if the specified socket is already bound through a previous reverse command.
member.returns: If your requested to start reverse to remote port TCP:0, the port number of the TCP port which has been opened. In all other cases, 0.

A which return
if the adb server was already running and the version of the adb server was at least .
if the adb server was already running, but the version was less than or less than the version of the adb client at and the flag was set.
if the adb server was not running, and the server was started.
if a operation is already in progress.

to restart the adb server if the version of the adb.exe executable at is newer than the version that is currently running; to keep a previous version of the server running.

list.item: if the adb server was already running and the version of the adb server was at least .
if the adb server was already running, but the version was less than or less than the version of the adb client at and the flag was set.
if the adb server was not running, and the server was started.
if an operation is already in progress.

member.exception: The server was not running, or an outdated version of the server was running, and the parameter was not specified.

member.name: M:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.IAdbServer.RestartServer
member.summary: Restarts the adb server if it suddenly became unavailable. Call this class if, for example, you receive an with the flag set to - a clear indicating the ADB server died.
member.remarks: You can only call this method if you have previously started the adb server via and passed the full path to the adb server.

member.name: M:AdvancedSharpAdbClient.IAdbServer.RestartServer(System.String)
member.summary: Restarts the adb server with new adb path if it suddenly became unavailable. Call this class if, for example, you receive an with the flag set to - a clear indicating the ADB server died.
member.param: The path to the adb.exe executable that can be used to start the adb server. If this path is not provided, this method will use the path that was cached by
member.remarks: You can only call this method if you have previously started the adb server via and passed the full path to the adb server.

summary.para: AdvancedSharpAdbClient is a .NET library that allows.NET applications to communicate with Android devices. It provides a.NET implementation of the adb protocol, giving more flexibility to the developer than launching an adb.exe process and parsing the console output.
Most of the adb functionality is exposed through the class. You can create your own instance of that class, or just use the instance we provide for you at
To send and receive files to and from Android devices, you can use the class.
To be notified when Android devices connect to or disconnect from your PC, you can use the class.

example.para: To list all Android devices that are connected to your PC, you can use the following code:

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler
member.summary: Provides a handler used by the language compiler to process interpolated strings into instances.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler.GuessedLengthPerHole
member.summary: Expected average length of formatted data used for an individual interpolation expression result.
member.remarks: This is inherited from string.Format, and could be changed based on further data. string.Format actually uses `format.Length + args.Length * 8`, but format.Length includes the format items themselves, e.g. "{0}", and since it's rare to have double-digit numbers of items, we bump the 8 up to 11 to account for the three extra characters in "{d}", since the compiler-provided base length won't include the equivalent character count.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler.MinimumArrayPoolLength
member.summary: Minimum size array to rent from the pool.
member.remarks: Same as stack-allocation size used today by string.Format.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler._provider
member.summary: Optional provider to pass to IFormattable.ToString or ISpanFormattable.TryFormat calls.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler._builder
member.summary: The used to build the string.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler._hasCustomFormatter
member.summary: Whether provides an ICustomFormatter.
member.remarks: Custom formatters are very rare. We want to support them, but it's ok if we make them more expensive in order to make them as pay-for-play as possible. So, we avoid adding another reference type field to reduce the size of the handler and to reduce required zero'ing, by only storing whether the provider provides a formatter, rather than actually storing the formatter. This in turn means, if there is a formatter, we pay for the extra interface call on each AppendFormatted that needs it.

member.summary: Gets the built .
member.returns: The built string.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler.ToStringAndClear
member.summary: Gets the built and clears the handler.
member.returns: The built string.
member.remarks: This releases any resources used by the handler. The method should be invoked only once and as the last thing performed on the handler. Subsequent use is erroneous, ill-defined, and may destabilize the process, as may using any other copies of the handler after ToStringAndClear is called on any one of them.

member.name: M:System.Index.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the offset from the start using the giving collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the Index will be used with. length has to be a positive value
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter and the returned offset value against negative values. we don't validate either the returned offset is greater than the input length. It is expected Index will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. If the returned offset is negative and then used to index a collection will get out of range exception which will be same affect as the validation.
